entities: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
United Nations Support Mission in Libya
summary:
The Security Council,
 
Recalling previous resolutions on Libya and terrorism, 
Reaffirming commitment to Libya's sovereignty and territorial integrity, 
Stressing national ownership and responsibility for sustainable peace, 
 

1. Calls on Libyan authorities to prevent proliferation of arms, particularly man-portable surface-to-air missiles.
2. Urges Libyan authorities to coordinate with the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons to destroy chemical weapons stockpiles.
3. Calls on regional states to prevent proliferation of arms.
4. Requests assistance to Libyan authorities and regional states to achieve this goal.
5. Requests the Committee established by resolution 1970 to assess threats and submit proposals to counter proliferation.
6. Requests Secretary-General to include updates on implementation in reports.
7. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
